title: Gov. Eric Holcomb rejects landlord-tenant bill, saying it's 'not the right time'
summary:

title: Indiana Repertory Theatre Announces 2020-21 Season
summary:
INDIANAPOLIS: Indiana Repertory Theatre has announced its 2020-21 season, featuring nine productions.

The season will continue with The Cat in the Hat (Jan. 30-Feb. 28, 2021), adapted by Katie Mitchell.
Next will be Ray Bradbury’s Farenheit 451 (Feb. 5-March 6, 2021), adapted by Tobias Andersen.
Indiana Repertory Theatre, founded in 1971, is committed to engage, surprise, and entertain the community of Indianapolis.

summary:

title: As unemployment claims surge, how Indiana's benefits compare to neighboring states
summary:

title: Indiana Beach might not be permanently closed
summary:
(WTHR) — Indiana Beach might still have some life in it after all.
On Thursday, the park tweeted an image with the words "permanently closed" but the word "permanently" was crossed out.
In February, California-based Apex Parks cited financial reasons for closing.
According to the White County Economic Development Corporation at the time, the company had “worked diligently” to find a new buyer but wasn’t successful.
Indiana Beach opened in 1926 and had become an iconic landmark along Lake Shafer in north central Indiana.

title: February Indiana Employment Report Released – WBIW
summary:
(INDIANAPOLIS) – Indiana’s unemployment rate stands at 3.1 percent for February and remains lower than the national rate of 3.5 percent.
Indiana’s labor force had a net increase of 3,114 over the previous month.
Indiana’s total labor force, which includes both Hoosiers employed and those seeking employment, stands at 3.39 million, and the state’s 64.4 percent labor force participation rate remains above the national rate of 63.4 percent.
Employment by SectorPrivate sector employment has decreased by 800 over the year and has grown by 3,900 over the previous month.
Total private employment stands at 2,748,000, which is 1,300 below the January 2019 peak.

The two races lost at Barber Motorsports Park and Circuit of The Americas will be made up by tripleheader rounds for all three levels – Indy Lights Presented by Cooper Tires, the Indy Pro 2000 Championship Presented by Cooper Tires and the Cooper Tires USF2000 Championship – at Road America and the Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course, helping to reduce costs to teams while maintaining an 18-race event schedule.

title: March super ‘Worm Moon’ will light Indianapolis sky on Monday
summary:
The last Supermoon of 2019, known as the ‘super worm equinox moon’ is seen above Los Angeles on March 20, 2019, coinciding with the spring equinox.
The supermoon, which has several names including the “Crow Moon” and “Worm Moon,” peaks Monday night.
It’s the last full moon of winter, according to NASA.
According to NASA, the various nicknames have their roots in native tribes in different parts of the U.S. Northern tribes called it the “Crow Moon” because the cawing of crows signaled the end of winter.
Southern tribes referred to it as the “Worm Moon” because of the earthworm casts that appear on the ground as the springtime thaw begins.

title: Marion County resident is first flu death of the season
summary:
A Marion County resident has died from influenza, the state's first flu death this year, state and county health officials reported Tuesday.
The first flu death of the season last year fell about two weeks later.
"While it is early in the flu season, this is not an indication of how severe the flu season will be," spokeswoman Greta Sanderson said in an email.
Some experts have suggested that this flu season could be a nasty one, based on the flu season in Australia, which often augurs what we see in the United States.
The state's first flu death prompted health officials to renew the call for all people over the age of 6 months to be vaccinated against the virus.

title: Hunter's Moon will make an appearance this weekend
summary:
INDIANAPOLIS (WTHR) — Another full moon will take over the sky this weekend — the Hunter's Moon.
This moon will make an appearance for three days beginning late Saturday into early Sunday morning and last through Tuesday morning.
Uniquely, the moon will remain visible from sunrise to sunset but will be most visible after sunset when it rises.
The Hunter's Moon is the full moon following the Harvest Moon and the one closest to the autumnal equinox.
The moon gets its name because it occurs at the time of the year when the leaves have fallen and time to hunt begins, according to NASA.

title: September 2019 was warmest on record in Indy - WISH-TV

This comes off the heels of the hottest September on record in Indianapolis.
The monthly temperature for September was 73.7 degrees, which is 6.7 degrees above normal.
2019 ended up having the third driest September on record.
The precipitation outlook does not show a clear factor, suggesting above- or below-normal precipitation for Indianapolis.

Law enforcement in Hancock County later found the suspect on the road and tried to pursue, but the suspect was able to elude them as well.

(INDIANAPOLIS) – Junior Achievement of Central Indiana announces four Laureates to be inducted at the 32nd Annual Central Indiana Business Hall of Fame Awards Gala, presented by Ice Miller, LLP, on Thursday, November 21.
The Central Indiana Business Hall of Fame was established in 1989 by the Junior Achievement Board of Directors to honor outstanding men and women who epitomize personal and professional success, high moral and ethical standards, and dedication to important civic causes, thereby improving the quality of life in our community.
Previously held in February or March, the Hall of Fame Gala will be on Thursday, November 21, 2019, at the Indiana Roof Ballroom.
Junior Achievement students will participate in the evening’s events, which will include introductions of the Laureates and video presentations highlighting their many accomplishments.
About Junior Achievement of Central IndianaJunior Achievement of Central Indiana, Inc. (JACI), in partnership with the business and education communities, empowers young people to own their future success.

title: IEA Finalizes $65 Million Wind Construction Contract in Iowa
summary:
windIEA Finalizes $65 Million Wind Construction Contract in IowaThe award is for the construction of a 150 MW wind farm in northern Iowa that, upon its anticipated completion in November 2020, will produce roughly 600,000 MWh of electricity each year, or enough energy to power roughly 70,000 homes.
White Construction will self-perform all of the engineering, procurement and construction needs of the project, including the building of access roads, the erection of wind generators, the installation of turbine foundations, and the construction of project substations and a medium-voltage collection system.
Iowa is a national leader in wind energy, ranking second in the U.S. for installed wind capacity.
Iowa was also the first state to produce more than 30% of its electricity from wind.
Wind construction projects, including that of this newest wind farm, will bring Iowa well over 10,000 MW of installed capacity within the next few years, according to the Iowa Environmental Council.

title: Indy breaks another record with December 15 snowfall
summary:
INDIANAPOLIS — Indianapolis is breaking records all over the place this year for the cold and snow — and it's not even winter yet.
On Sunday, December 15, Indianapolis broke a new record for the amount of snowfall on that day — one that's been in place for the last 72 years.
The previous record, set on December 15, 1947 was for 3.5 inches of snow.
During the first cold-snap of the season, Indy broke several low temp records including one that had been in place for over a century.

title: State of Indiana to Host International Business Conference in April 2020
summary:
INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 20, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- Indiana Secretary of Commerce Jim Schellinger and the Indiana Economic Development Corporation (IEDC) will host an inaugural Indiana Global Economic Summit in Indianapolis next spring.
“In Indiana, we work every day to create a top-ranked business climate that encourages growth, supports collaboration and fosters innovation,” said Indiana Governor Eric J. Holcomb.
Conference programming will occur at the Indiana Convention Center and The Westin Indianapolis downtown, and attendees will visit the Indianapolis Motor Speedway and Indiana State Museum during evening receptions.
Additionally, the state is committed to improving global connectivity and has allocated $20 million to support new international routes.

title: University of Indianapolis holds Commencement Ceremony Dec. 14, 2019
summary:
INDIANAPOLIS—The University of Indianapolis will hold a Commencement Ceremony at 10:00 a.m., Saturday, Dec. 14, 2019, in Ransburg Auditorium, Esch Hall.
261 students will graduate from the University in December, including 198 undergraduates, 56 graduate and 7 doctoral students.
President Robert L. Manuel will preside over Saturday’s ceremony, which includes a full academic procession and musical performances by University faculty.
Emily Slaven, University of Indianapolis 2019 Teacher of the Year, will provide the Commencement address.
The total number of University of Indianapolis graduates for 2019 (May, August and December combined) stands at 1,534 students, with 1,030 undergraduate, 371 graduate, and 133 doctoral students.

title: IMPD crime unit make meth arrest, recover 7 guns
summary:
— An arrest made Wednesday by the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department (IMPD) yielded seven guns and around 230 grams of methamphetamine.
According to police, IMPD’s Crime Gun Intelligence Center (CGIC) conducted an investigation in the 300 block of N. Chester Ave. on December 11.
During the service of a search warrant, CGIC recovered seven guns, including a rifle stolen in a 2016 gun store burglary.
IMPD said in a statement:“CGIC is an inter-agency collaboration, led by IMPD and the ATF, focused on the timely collection and analysis of crime gun evidence to identify serial shooters and disrupt violent crime.
Since January, CGIC has led to the removal of 321 violent individuals and 229 crime guns from the Indianapolis community.”

summary:

The connection to ocean temperatures have a profound impact on winter weather patterns across North America and yield some clues as to how the winter season may evolve.
No El Nino (warmer ocean temperatures), No La Nina (colder ocean temperatures).
A "wavy" and more volatile weather pattern could lead to quick temperature swings and shots of much colder air.
Above normal snowfall could be in the works as an upper-air pattern pattern emerges from mid-December on, and it would lend to the overall above normal snowfall forecast for the entire season.
